title: 105_hr2421
content: The Military Selective Service Act is repealed. The Military Selective Service Act is repealed, and assets, contracts, property, and records held by the Selective Service System will be transferred to the Administrator of General Services. The Office of Selective Service Records will not be reestablished, and employees will be assisted in transferring to other positions in the executive branch. Conforming amendments will be made to Title 5 of the United States Code. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing references to specific sections of the Selective Training and Service Act and the Selective Service Act. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing references to specific sections of the Selective Training and Service Act and the Selective Service Act. This includes changes in Title 10 of the United States Code, such as striking out certain subsections and paragraphs. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing references to specific sections of the Selective Training and Service Act and the Selective Service Act, including changes in Title 10 of the United States Code. This involves striking out certain subsections and paragraphs related to military induction and service. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing references to specific sections of the Selective Training and Service Act and the Selective Service Act, including changes in Title 10 of the United States Code. This involves striking out certain subsections and paragraphs related to military induction and service. In section 12208(a) and section 12647, references to the Military Selective Service Act are removed. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended by removing references to specific sections of the Selective Training and Service Act and the Selective Service Act. This includes changes in Title 10 of the United States Code, such as striking out subsections and paragraphs related to military induction and service. In the table of sections, the item relating to section 12647 is replaced with a new item. Title 22, 26, 29, and 37 of various Acts are amended by removing or redesignating certain sections. In Title 37, section 209(a) has its last sentence struck out. In section 209(a), the last sentence is struck out. In section 308e(1), certain clauses are removed. Title 42 is amended in sections 210(m)(5) and 1007(b) of the Social Security Act and Legal Services Corporation Act respectively. The Act allows for legal assistance in cases related to desertion from the Armed Forces, with an effective date set 180 days after enactment.
